column4: sooo I think my ubuntu install is dying. I keep getting errors when i try ot run sudo apt-get upgrade or any apt-get, and compiz freezes on boot-up so i have to manually kill it every boot up.... and python programs like the printer setup window fails.
anyone wanna help me figure out why my apt-get says this: (paste binning now)
put the errors from sudo apt-get -f install on paste.ubuntu.com
doh, dummy me. repeat,  with start option :)
ok, now   sudo invoke-rc.d dbus force-reload
-  * Reloading system message bus config...                                [ OK ]
try running   sudo apt-get -f install again. Those are the two commands that would get run during the post installation phase
did you get * Starting System Tools Backends system-tools-backends   [OK]   or [FAIL] ?
ok, we're gonna do a little surgery.   in a terminal, type   sudo nano /var/lib/dpkg/info/system-tools-backend.postinst
yes. But I'd rename that file to get rid of spaces myself
sudo nano less /var/lib/dpkg/info/system-tools-backends.postinst  I forgot the s
you see the line with set -e ?
on the line just below it, add     exit 0
- do you mind doing this over private message so i can read things easier?
